content.description: A fun climb to do if you want something easier and are already in the area.  A helmet isn't a bad idea on this awkward climb since people seemed to be bumping their heads a lot.  Go straight up the wide crack in the corner to the left of Poison Vines.
Up the crack on the south side of L-Buttress.  Solid pro for leading.  The crux is the last ten feet to the top out.  Another fun Blue Mounds crack that sees little traffic.
content.protection:
Standard TR set up - small/medium nuts and cams.  Long slings are helpful. 

  Nuts and cams for the lead - nothing too big.

content.description: Began very near the left side of the large roof below the outside corner.  Once on top of the roof, stay between the outside corner and the Poison Vines crack.
content.location: South face of L-Buttress underneath the left side of the roof. Starts lower about 7 feet lower than the rest of the south-face climbs.Â

content.description:
Loose Rock goes up the face approximately ten feet to the climber's right of Hammer.  Mantle your way up onto the good ledge about ten feet off the ground and climb the rest of the way on consistent and interesting 5.8 climbing. 

  A bit of loose stuff the name refers to is near the top, but it didn't come off for me and is probably avoidable.  Be careful of what you're cranking on as you get higher, but this route is still worth doing.
content.protection: Standard TR set up - small/medium nuts and cams.  Long slings are helpful.
content.location: Ten feet right of Hammer, straight up the face.

content.description: First crack around the corner right of Loose Rock.

The first crux is getting to the second crux without falling. Maybe start middle, working up left then straight right back to middle. From there head up middle on small or sloping holds. Stay out of cracks on either side.
content.location: Face climb in between Power Booster and Poison Vines. Don't use crack on either side

content.description: On the east face, begin on the corner just below the enormous roof.  From here go more or less straight up, wandering a bit at times to find holds.  The crux is the last 15' or so.
content.protection:
Standard TR set up - small/medium nuts and cams.  Long slings are helpful. 

  Not much pro that I'm aware of on lead.
content.location: Up the corner under the roof and straight up from there.

content.description: One arms length left of Power Booster.
content.location: One arms length left of Power Booster.

content.description: Low-traffic, shaded, good top/bottom access, somewhat varied difficulty selection, and a mostly flat and clean base.
